title: R-Ladies Porto Alegre: 6º Meetup R-Ladies Porto Alegre
description:
ATENÇÃO! A data do evento é 16/12 - 19h30

Olá, Ladies!

Vamos nos encontrar antes do final do ano?

Gostaríamos de ver como vocês, ladies, têm usado o R em seus trabalhos e pesquisas, inscreva-se para apresentação! Basta entrar em contato com a gente aqui pelo Meetup, através de nosso e-mail [masked] ou de nosso Twitter @RLadiesPOA.

Todas são muito bem vindas. Não esqueça de convidar outras ladies a participar! (:

***************
PROGRAMAÇÃO:
***************
Machine Learning em modelos de Credit Scoring: um estudo de caso.

Resumo: Cansada de sempre desenvolver modelos com Regressão Logística quando se trata de crédito? A fim de contornar (ou justificar seu uso), fiz um estudo de caso comparando esta técnica padrão com alguns modelos de Machine Learning: Árvore de Decisão, Random Forest, Bagging, Support Vector Machine e Adaboost. Até que ponto vale o investimento nestas novas tecnologias quando o cenário envolve concessão de crédito?

Cinthia Becker - Formada em Estatística pela UFRGS, atualmente está cursando pós-graduação em Data Science e Big Data na Uniritter, além de trabalhar com modelagem de crédito na Realize CFI/Lojas Renner. Apaixonada pelo R desde a graduação, nos últimos anos tem-se aventurado em Python também.

***************
Mais em breve!
***************

Lembramos que R-Ladies tem como objetivo proporcionar uma experiência livre de assédio para todos. Não toleramos nenhuma forma de assédio aos participantes. Para ter acesso ao código de conduta, acesse: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#portuguese

title: R-Ladies Perth: One Year of R-Ladies Perth
description:
***SAVE THE DATE***

Come help us celebrate one year of R-Ladies Perth workshops and networking events!!

We will discuss what has and hasn't worked, enable networking over some food and drinks (since a lot of you attended different R-Ladies events), and plan for the first half of 2020. There will also be a brief seminar on how to search, clone and work-through available workshop materials on the R-Ladies Global and associated chapter GitHub's (NOTE: this can be a useful resource between events or for learning more about specific packages/topics).

We can't wait to meet you all again!!

Remember to spread the word -- invite your colleagues and work/study friends.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend our events!!!!

P.S. everyone is welcome at all R-Ladies events but in general we encourage men to bring at least one potential member that meets the R-Ladies Global mission of supporting minority gender R enthusiasts (https://rladies.org/about-us/).

We would also like to thank our sponsors for this event: Murdoch University, the Curtin Institute for Computation, and Flux powered by Spacecubed.

title: R-Ladies Budapest: rstudio::conf(2020) Watch Parties Budapest
description:
"rstudio::conf, the conference for all things R and RStudio, will take place January 29 and 30, 2020 in San Francisco, California." The host is Hadley Wickham, Chief Scientist of RStudio, and the keynote speakers are Hilary Parker (Stitch Fix), Roger Peng (Johns Hopkins), Martin Wattenberg, Fernanda Viegas (Research Scientists, Google), Jenny Bryan (Engineer, RStudio) and JJ Allaire (CEO, RStudio).

We got invited to join this exciting event together via the so called watch parties where we watch first the pre-game event just before the first keynote. "This live-streamed pre-game event will feature short interviews with folks from RStudio as well as the wider R-Community. During this event the attendees at the watch parties will have an opportunity to interact with the host and guests in real time. The pre-game event will lead directly into the keynote and session live-streams."

You may find the agenda here: https://web.cvent.com/event/36ebe042-0113-44f1-8e36-b9bc5d0733bf/websitePage:34f3c2eb-9def-44a7-b324-f2d226e25011

title: R-Ladies Barcelona: Introduction to RMarkdown and friends
description:
Rmarkdown is a file format & package for making dynamic documents and automatic reports with R.

19:00 - 19:30: "R Markdown" short workshop by Sarah Bonnin
19:30 - 20:30: Short talks of {rmarkdown} related packages, such as: {bookdown}, {pkdown}, {blogdown} or {xaringan}.
20:30 - 21:00: Drinks & Networking

--> R Markdown
In the {rmarkdown} workshop we will learn how to build simple and reproducible reports with {rmarkdown}.
The short talks will show you the powerful tools based on {rmarkdown} to produce slides, books, blogs and package documentation.

--> About Sarah Bonnin
Sarah is an R-Ladies Barcelona co-organizer. She did a Bsc in biology and a Msc in bioinformatics in France, before settling down in Barcelona. She currently works as a bioinformatician at the CRG (Center for Genomic Regulation) where she analyzes all kinds of omics data and provides trainings in R, Linux, and Next Generation Sequencing data analysis.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SarahFBonnin
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarahbonnin/

--> Where?
Talent Garden Barcelona (Carrer Muntaner 239 3ºA)

--> What do you need to follow this workshop?
+ B.Y.O.L. (Bring Your Own Laptop - Remember to charge it before the workshop!).
+ R (>=3.6.0) & RStudio.
+ R packages: rmardown, ggplot2, dplyr, kableExtra

--> Attending the Meetup
Remember that in the R-Ladies Meetups we expect to have a majority of R-Ladies, so if you are a man you should come with another R-Lady or invite a non-male friend to the Meetup!

Places are limited, book your spot now!!

description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

We will have an event on Wednesday January 29, 2020 from 5:30-7pm at Allovue (https://allovue.com). We will have presentations discussing what are Shiny apps, how you can you can build them, and demo-ing a few ones we love!

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
- If you heard of this thing called 'Shiny' in R, but no idea what it is!
- If you know about Shiny apps, but no idea how to build one!
- If you just want to see some awesome examples of web applications in R!

title: R en Buenos Aires: Metele datos a R con SQL y APIs.
description:
¿De dónde saco datos y cómo los meto en R?

¿Estás buscando datos interesantes para practicar tu conocimiento de análisis en R? ¿Sabés cómo ajustar modelos estrambódicos pero te aburriste de fitearlos a mtcars o iris? Este encuentro es para vos.

Datos, datos y más datos.

* Pachá (@pachamaltese) va a dar un taller para aprender a gestionar bases de datos en SQL y conectarlas con R.

* Natalia Salaberry (@agnra) va a dar una charla sobre cómo detectar problemas en el uso de la tarjeta SUBE bajando datos de twitter.

¿Qué necesito tener instalado para el taller?
Necesitás las librerías: RPostgreSQL, dplyr, dbplyr, tradestatistics y highcharter. Instalá todo con:

install.packages(c("RPostgreSQL", "dplyr", "dbplyr", "tradestatistics", "highcharter"))

En esta ocasión nos recibe EANT (https://eant.tech/). Muchas gracias por el espacio y las galletitas! 🍪️

"Me encanta la idea, pero no puedo ir. 😭 ¿Va a haber streaming por internet?🙏"
Si todo sale bien, ¡sí! Seguinos en Twitter (@renbaires) donde vamos a compartir el link cuando lo tengamos!

Cualquier consulta no dudes en escribirnos por meetup o por twitter.

¡Nos vemos!

title: Düsseldorf R User Group: Geo experiments and regression specification uncertainty
description:
Hi everyone! We'll be back for one more event before the year ends, sponsored by trivago (https://www.trivago.com/), with two talks:

• Measuring the incremental impact of marketing campaigns with geo experiments (My Loan Tong)
• Regression specification uncertainty - A smooth brute force approach (Marcelo Bohrer do Nascimento)

*** Agenda ***
• 18:30 - 19:00: Arrive, get a drink and socialise
• 19:00 - 19:10: Quick introduction
• 19:10 - 19:30: My Loan's Talk + Q&A
• 19:30 - 19:40: Break
• 19:40 - 20:00: Marcelo's Talk + Q&A
• 20:00 - Open End: Socialise

Please remember to bring your ID card - our security company requires it to provide you a guest badge!

*** Measuring the incremental impact of marketing campaigns with geo experiments ***

The challenge with understanding the impact of brand marketing campaigns, especially for offline advertising, is that we are not always able to measure the additional conversions generated by a campaign. One way to address this issue is to use a geo experiment: a quasi-experiment that measures the causal impact of a marketing intervention. It's similar to an A/B test but instead of assigning individuals randomly to control and treatment groups, geographic regions are used to define the groups. I will give an introduction on how we use geo experiments at trivago to test the effectiveness of our marketing investments and explain how the tests are set up and analyzed in R.

My Loan Tong is a data analyst at trivago. With a degree in Business Mathematics and Analytics but no Marketing knowledge, she joined the Marketing Intelligence team two years ago and has since been analyzing TV, Online Video and Out-of-Home campaigns.

-----------------------------------------

*** Regression specification uncertainty - A smooth brute force approach ***

abstract and speaker info coming soon

-----------------------------------------

Thanks to trivago for hosting & sponsoring this edition of the Düsseldorf R User Group Meetup. There will be food and drinks available.

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Books In Bars - How to Lie with Maps
description:
Spend Friday night discussing How to Lie with Maps (https://www.amazon.com/How-Lie-Maps-Mark-Monmonier/dp/0226534219).

Originally published to wide acclaim, this lively, cleverly illustrated essay on the use and abuse of maps teaches us how to evaluate maps critically and promotes a healthy skepticism about these easy-to-manipulate models of reality. Monmonier shows that, despite their immense value, maps lie. In fact, they must.

The second edition is updated with the addition of two new chapters, 10 color plates, and a new foreword by renowned geographer H. J. de Blij. One new chapter examines the role of national interest and cultural values in national mapping organizations, including the United States Geological Survey, while the other explores the new breed of multimedia, computer-based maps.

To show how maps distort, Monmonier introduces basic principles of mapmaking, gives entertaining examples of the misuse of maps in situations from zoning disputes to census reports, and covers all the typical kinds of distortions from deliberate oversimplifications to the misleading use of color.

"Professor Monmonier himself knows how to gain our attention; it is not in fact the lies in maps but their truth, if always approximate and incomplete, that he wants us to admire and use, even to draw for ourselves on the facile screen. His is an artful and funny book, which like any good map, packs plenty in little space."—Scientific American

"A useful guide to a subject most people probably take too much for granted. It shows how map makers translate abstract data into eye-catching cartograms, as they are called. It combats cartographic illiteracy. It fights cartophobia. It may even teach you to find your way. For that alone, it seems worthwhile."—Christopher Lehmann-Haupt, The New York Times

". . . witty examination of how and why maps lie. [The book] conveys an important message about how statistics of any kind can be manipulated. But it also communicates much of the challenge, aesthetic appeal, and sheer fun of maps. Even those who hated geography in grammar school might well find a new enthusiasm for the subject after reading Monmonier's lively and surprising book."—Wilson Library Bulletin

"A reading of this book will leave you much better defended against cheap atlases, shoddy journalism, unscrupulous advertisers, predatory special-interest groups, and others who may use or abuse maps at your expense."—John Van Pelt, Christian Science Monitor

"Monmonier meets his goal admirably. . . . [His] book should be put on every map user's 'must read' list. It is informative and readable . . . a big step forward in helping us to understand how maps can mislead their readers."—Jeffrey S. Murray, Canadian Geographic

PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: Dublin R: Why R?  @ Career Zoo Limerick
description:
Why R? Limerick will be taking place at Career Zoo Limerick

Career Zoo Limerick is taking place at Thomond Park Conference Centre on Saturday 1st February.

About Why R?
Why R? pre-meetings are R meetups that support local R communities. Their main goal is to promote the work of the Why R? foundation, who run an annual community conference in Poland.

Another purpose of those meetings is to provide space for the professional networking and knowledge exchange for practitioners and students from the areas of statistical machine learning, programming, optimization and data science.

We have already managed to co-organize 12 R meetups around Central-Eastern Europe, among others in Warsaw, Prague, Amsterdam, Copenhagen or Wroclaw. We often provide beverages and pizza, cover transportation and accommodation costs for speakers and pay for the after party. Such meetings are a great opportunity to understand the needs and areas of interest of R users around the Europe.

Those meetings would not happen without the help of local R hosts who have invested a lot of time and energy in this project!

title: Seattle useR Group (R Programming Language): R and Data Vis in December!
description:
We are in for a real treat tonight with two great talks on Data viz in R. We have Bethany Yollin talking about leveraging {shiny} to make interactive data viz tools and Howard Baek presenting on how to use {gganimate} to make animations in R.

A massive thank you to the both of you for taking the time to create these great presentations!

Animating Expected Possession Value in the NBA with gganimate, A Grammar of Animated Graphics - Howard Baek

In this talk, I will talk about the steps I took to generate the graphics and the actionable insights gained. The first part of this talk will cover the process I took to create the animations in R, mainly focusing on the gganimate R package but covering other supplementary tidyverse functions. The second part of this talk will be on the knowledge gained from these animations, most of which confirm our intuition about basketball. Hopefully, after this talk, I inspire the audience to go out and look for interesting data to work on.

Enhance your Shiny applications with interactive charts, tables, maps and more! - Bethany Yollin:

This presentation will highlight several R libraries that enable Shiny developers to leverage the power of Javascript--no web development experience required.
The presentation will be accompanied by live demos and fully-reproducible code that can be repurposed for your data visualization needs. Concepts from this presentation will come together to create a Seattle collisions dashboard to monitor pedestrian safety.

group: Taiwan R User Group / MLDM Monday
description:
Abstract:
People use various statistical models to predict the real world. However, it is usually hard to find the causal relation laying behind the reality. I will talk about:
(1) why we should distinguish between causality and correlation
(2) how economists identify causality and
(3) how economists find causality.

講者簡介：
RedHerrings/ 經濟學科普網站 白經濟 TalkEcon 作者之一，目前是在 UCSB 念書的亂世中一個迷途小書僮。

title: Taiwan R User Group / MLDM Monday: MLDM Monday｜Kaggle CV 2019 暑期激鬥戰事報導
group: Taiwan R User Group / MLDM Monday
description:
Title:

kaggle CV 2019暑期激鬥戰事報導

Abstract:

在國內被BERT轟炸了一年之後, 做computer vision的你會不會覺得很悶呢? kaggle告訴你還不用懷疑人生. 今年暑期開始kaggle一連舉辦了12個跟CV有關的比賽,佔所有比賽的80%. 其中有四個生醫相關的,4個是Google自家辦的數據量TB級的OpenImage大賽,也有加入LIDAR的自動車應用.一個裝可愛的狗狗影像生成. 題目類型從classification, semantic segmentation, instance segmentation, object detection, GAN都有.

所以我想要分享我們能從這些比賽中學到什麼, 現在kaggle的比賽生態變成什麼樣, 以及kaggle的state of art algorithm整理.
從細節來說我會探討技術例題如: 1. resnet還是稱霸CNN的比賽嗎, EfficientNet呢?, 2. 現在不用metric learning來做多分類的題目就落伍了嗎? 3. segmentation還是UNet一招走天下? 4. object detection用yolo有任何競爭力嗎? 5. 要怎麼結合youtube video影像(3+1D)跟聲音(1+1D)的數據來做classification? 6. 怎麼結合LIDAR的數據來做object detection?

跟一些其他八卦如: 1. 去年要贏已經用到512顆GPU了, 今年要幾顆? 2. 來戰是tensorflow還是pytorch比較紅吧? 3. 有沒有比較好用的高端整合工具fastai, catalyst+mlcomp? 4. 一起來笑在討論區高調的人最後排名會掉多少? 5. 有多少新手拿獎金? 6. kaggle kernel不錯用但果然被操爆的過程.

總之一起來感受無止無盡的kaggle人生吧

Speaker:

馬成軍

做了20年的天文物理研究 (對 可以跟幫甜甜圈照相拉上點關係),轉行做data science. 在被找去做Pinkoi做data scientist之前就立志拿到kaggle competition master. 在做公司的商品排序跟推薦的時候, 看著跟外面DNN技術脫節, 失心瘋的離職專職在kaggle打怪, 重持拿master的人生目標.

Every week, the R4DS learning community releases a fun dataset, for local groups to come together and explore. Check out the #tidytuesday hashtag on twitter for examples, or read more here: https://thomasmock.netlify.com/post/tidytuesday-a-weekly-social-data-project-in-r/

This event will be joint with our friends in the PyData SLO meetup.

title: R-Ladies New Delhi: Wavelet Applications in Economics & Finance by M&S Research Hub
description:
RLadies Delhi in collaboration with M&S Research Hub is organizing a 2 day workshop on Wavelet Applications in Economics & Finance.

Workshop Timings would be 1 PM - 5 PM on 19th and 20th Dec.

Content of the workshop
DAY-1
1. Introduction to R-Programming Language and R-studio Interface
2. The basic concept of Wavelet and its applications
3. Decomposition and plotting of the series using the MODWT method.
4. Wavelet Correlation
5. Wavelet Covariance
6. Cross-Wavelet Correlation

DAY-2
1. Continuous Wavelet Transform
2. Cross Wavelet Transform
3. Wavelet Coherence
4. Partial Wavelet Coherence
5. Introduction of MATLAB
6. Application of Continuous Wavelet Transform, Wavelet Coherence, Partial and Multiple Wavelet Coherence (Using MATLAB)

Each Participate will get certificate of enrollment.
Registration fees include the workshop material and data files.

If registered through RLadies you will get 30% off on registration fees.
If more than 10 RLadies would register, discount would be 50%, please do RSVP first to avail the discount.

For more details - https://ms-researchhub.com/home/conferences/wavelet-workshop.html

Last date of registration is 25th November 2019.

title: R-Ladies Boston: December Social
description:
December is a hard time to schedule things, so R-Ladies Boston has historically done a low-key December "pub nite". This year we're switching it up slightly and meeting at the Clover Food Lab in Kendall Square (right above the T station, in the Google building). This allows for purchase of tasty dinner options as well as beer and that holy grail, the Equally Attractive Non-Alcoholic Beverage (fancy teas and sodas!).

Please bring money/card to pay for your food & drink - purchase isn't required to attend but we hope you will support this business while we use their space.

Pop in and say hi, or stay longer and workshop your ideas for events, projects, or R-Ladies talks (wink)

title: R-Ladies Calgary: R-Ladies Calgary inaugural meetup
description:
Welcome to R-Ladies Calgary!

This is our first meeting and we would love to meet as many of you as possible! Come along and meet fellow R enthusiasts, have some snacks, and help us decide the direction for the Calgary Chapter.

For those of you who aren't sure what R-Ladies is about, it is a worldwide organisation that aims to achieve proportionate representation of minority genders in the R community (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).

Please fill out the following questionnaire before attending: https://forms.gle/g9w6BZQ83V28BQ8a8

We are looking forward to meeting you!

title: R-Ladies Concepción: SatRday Concepción, Chile
description:
SatRday es una conferencia de bajo costo que se enfoca en R y el evento principal se lleva a cabo un sábado. La naturaleza de bajo costo y de fin de semana del evento significa que es accesible para una amplia gama de personas que de otra manera no podrían asistir.
La idea es que el aprendizaje sobre R sea accesible y local, nuestro enfoque está en llevar R a las personas en lugar de hacer que las personas vayan a R. Esto ayuda a construir una comunidad local diversa y creciente de usuarios de R.

title: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup: Data Science North East: January Meeting
group: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup
description:
Details
Schedule:

6:00 - Food and drinks
6:30 - Matthew Forshaw (NCL Uni): Best practice in reproducible data science in R
7:15 - Matt Edwards: An Introduction to Interpreting Machine Learning Models

An Introduction to Interpreting Machine Learning Models

Abstract: The most accurate predictive models in Machine Learning are often the least interpretable (e.g. random forest) and the most interpretable models are often the least accurate (e.g. linear regression). Hence, there is often a conflict between accuracy and interpretability. We want the most accurate models but don’t want to sacrifice interpretability. In this talk, I discuss this conflict and some new methods in Machine Learning for interpreting ANY predictive model so you do not have to sacrifice predictive accuracy. A package (https://github.com/mt-edwards/xrayspecs) is also introduced that provides these new methods for R programmers.
